intro: Sphenodesme barbata, commonly known as the hairy sphenodesme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
